keywords.indexterm: Content Author GuideContent Fusion Task Manager view

body.p: As the Content Author, once you have installed the Content Fusion Connector plugin, the Content Fusion Task Manager view can be accessed. To open the view, click the Show Content Fusion Task Manager toolbar button (or go to Window Show View Content Fusion Task Manager ). This view is where you can create tasks, manage them, attach documents, and upload them to the server.
If this is your first time using it, click the Connect button to open the interface in your most recently used browser, then click on SIGN UP and follow the instructions to create your account.
If you already have an account but you are not connected, click the Connect button to open the interface in your most recently used browser and click Authorize.
The Content Fusion Task Manager view contains the following actions and components:

dlentry.dd:
Once connected and authorized, your user name will appear in the upper right corner of the view. The drop-down menu offers the following actions:
Refresh Tasks Forces a refresh to synchronize the information in the view with the server.
Go to my Account Opens your profile information in your most recently used browser.
Help Opens the user guide in your most recently used browser.
Disconnect Signs you out of . To re-establish connection, you need to click Connect and then Authorize.

Use this box to create new tasks. Drag files from the Project view, DITA Maps Manager, or your system file explorer and drop them in this box (or click the choose link to select files) to add the files to a new task.
Files to Review You will see all of the attached files in this section.
Context DITA Map If you are working with a DITA project, you should attach the context root map so that all references and defined keys can be resolved and displayed properly for the Reviewers. You can drag the DITA map file and drop it in this box or click to the Choose Context Map button to select the map.
Task Details You must enter a description or title for the task in the Summary field. This task summary will help you differentiate between multiple tasks so each description should be unique.
Upload/Cancel buttons Once you are finished adding files and entering a task summary, use the Upload button to finalize the task and upload it to the server. Use the Cancel button to cancel the task creation process.

Each created task is listed with its own box in the view. Click on the name of a task to open the interface in your most recently used browser where you can view the details of the task and share a link to it with Reviewers.

Once the Reviewers are done with their process, you will have access to a Get Changes link. Clicking this link opens the Merge tool that allows you to automatically merge all the changes back into Oxygen XML Editor or Oxygen XML Author.

Once you are finished merging the changes, you can click the Delete Task link to remove it from the view and . It is recommended that you always delete tasks that have been merged so that you do not accidentally merge them again since that could create some complicated conflicts.
